column4: Let me rephrase that. I have Ubuntu Edgy 6.10 installed with Ubuntu Studio 7.04 installed afterwards... When I boot into 6.10 and look at /boot/grub/menu.lst it only shows the 6.10 menu items and none of the 7.04 items? So where are the missing menu entries hiding?
Also.. is there any way for me to see the 7.04 filesystem from within 6.10?
is it on the same hard disk? partition? what is your 6.10/7.04 setup
they are installed on two different drives
on 6.10, did you mount the 7.04 drive?
it's visible on the desktop, but for some reason it just shows everything on the 6.10 hard drive
when u go to the mounted 7,04 drive, and go to your home folder, is it the same as your 6.10 folder?
maybe 7.04 installer is very smart and links the 7.04 home folder with the older home folder.
so you get easy transition between 6.10 and 7.04, but im' not sure
if you "ls" inside a folder if will draw symbolic links in cyan so you can check if the 7.04 home folder is actually a link to the old home folder

I don't know... but the problem I have is quite stupid - I know my password for my 7.04 partition, but I've forgotten the username since I have not booted into 7.04 for several months - I was hoping if I could see the home folder of 7.04 from 6.10 then I would be able to see the username from the 7.04 home folder.
you can boot the 7.04 in safe mode adn reset your passworrd
you just choose the safe mode on grub, and it gets you to a root prompt
ok.. I didn't know that. I give that a go..
Thanks for that.. I didn't need to change password or anything... I was able to see the 7.04 home directory from the recovery mode root command line and therefore remember the username to log in ;)
